title.native: ハチミツとクローバー II

description:
The sequel and final installment to the highly popular series once again delves into the life stories and love lives of Takemoto Yuuta, Mayama Takumi and Morita Shinobu. The story continues where the first season left off, after Takemoto's self-discovery journey around Japan. Of course, the love triangles and tribulations they face will continue, and eventually decide the paths to their future.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

title.native: ハチミツとクローバー
ハチミツとクローバー

node.description:
Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chicaumino) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chicaumino)

Chica Umino is the pen name of​ an anonymous Japanese female mangaka, designer, and illustrator. She graduated from the Tokyo Metropolitan Art and Craft High School. Her pen name comes from her favorite location Umi no Chikaku no Yuuenchi (海の近くの遊園地, lit. an amusement park by the sea), which is also the title of her doujinshi works prior to her debut. She likes Harry Potter and anime by Hayao Miyazaki. She calls herself an otaku.    

Umino still keeps contact with Hiroshi Kamiya and Mikako Takahashi, who voice Takemoto and Yamada, respectively from the anime adaptation of Honey and Clover.
He's a Japanese musician and singer-songwriter from Tokyo.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.
He also sang Monochrome no Shoujo (Monochrome Girl) theme song.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/spitz__1987/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/spitzclips) | [Website](https://spitz-web.com/)

A Japanese rock band. They have sustained commercial success in the Japanese market ever since their breakthrough in the mid '90s. They have been listed in the top 30 of the best-selling music acts in history of the Japanese record charts, having sold over 20.8 million copies albums and singles domestically as of December 2013.

**Members:**
- [Masamune Kusano](https://anilist.co/staff/265920/) (草野マサムネ) - vocals, guitar
- Tetsuya Miwa (三輪テツヤ) - guitar
- Akihiro Tamura (田村明浩) - bass
- Tatsuo Sakiyama (﨑山龍男) - drums
Yuuzou Hayashi is a composer and arranger.

__[Website](https://www.yukiweb.net/)__

She debuted in the music industry in 1991 as the lead vocalist for the rock band [JUDY AND MARY](https://anilist.co/staff/218017), and as a solo artist in 2002.

__[Website](https://www.yukiweb.net/)__

She debuted in the music industry in 1991 as the lead vocalist for the rock band [JUDY AND MARY](https://anilist.co/staff/218017), and as a solo artist in 2002.

__[Website](https://www.yukiweb.net/)__

She debuted in the music industry in 1991 as the lead vocalist for the rock band [JUDY AND MARY](https://anilist.co/staff/218017), and as a solo artist in 2002.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/島村秀一)
Yoshio Ookouchi is a composite artist affiliated with A-1 Pictures.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福田道生)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Debuted as a director on [Hyakko](https://anilist.co/anime/4550/).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.
Started off as a composite artist.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大畑清隆)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福田道生)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Debuted as a director on [Hyakko](https://anilist.co/anime/4550/).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.
Adept in various fields related to computer graphics.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/), where he initially worked as a composite artist.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/101468/) by the same name._

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Chapter 1 – "It's the first time I've seen the moment a person falls in love. Oh, man..."
Episode 2 - Chapter 2 – "Seeing Hagu got me kind of panicked... or something." – "Two loves start turning"
Episode 3 - Chapter 3 – "Listen. Why me?" – "Two loves, unrequited"
Episode 4 - Chapter 4 – "The truth is, I don't like Christmas that much." – "He and she sway slowly"
Episode 5 - Chapter 5 – "Yeah. I'm home." – "Thinking of Mother back home"
Episode 6 - Chapter 6 – "Hey, Ayumi Yamada... Why did you fall for a guy like me?" – "The past, the tears and the confession"
Episode 7 - Chapter 7 – "Hagu, let's go together." – "We're searching for a miracle"
Episode 8 - Chapter 8 – "Ah... she's so far away." – "I couldn't leave you alone"
Episode 9 - Chapter 9 – "Has she realized it? Why don't I tell her?" – "That brooch was so heavy"
Episode 10 - Chapter 10 – "It's not something to abandon so easily, is it?" – "Crossing the sky"
Episode 11 - Chapter 11 – "I–I didn't have fun." – "Pushed around by love"
Episode 12 - Chapter 12 – "You jerk! What're you thinking?!" – "The sudden kiss... the sudden parting"
Chapter L – Lohmeyer–Sempai Special – "We come face to face with a legend"
Episode 13 - Chapter 13 – "What kind of answer was I expecting from her?" – "That one thing was all I wanted to hear"
Episode 14 - Chapter 14 – "She appeared in my dream last night..." – "I Touched Her in a Dream"
Episode 15 - Chapter 15 – "Rika, would you allow me work at Harada Design again?" – "You're Such a Fool! What Were You Thinking?"
Episode 16 - Chapter 16 – "I won't mention the third choice." – "The Moon is Calling Her"
Episode 17 - Chapter 17 – "What I don't have is a destination." – "I Don't Understand My Own Feelings
Episode 18 - Chapter 18 – "When Shinobu comes back... What is she going to do? And...[What am *I* going to do?]" – "He Came Back"[
Chapter F – Fujiwara Design Special – "You're the Fashion Champ"
Episode 19 - Chapter 19 – "Takumi always just watches me go." – "Time Begins To Move Forward Again"
Episode 20 - Chapter 20 – "It's your duty to care for that, right?!" – "I Said a Prayer to the Moon Above Us"
Episode 21 - Chapter 21 – "It's empty..." – "I'd Always Been Afraid"
Episode 22 - Chapter 22 – "After passing through a tunnel, I came out in a beautiful place." – "Like a Flower Wet with Rain"
Episode 23 - Chapter 23 – "And after that, I set out again." – "Now, I Start Running"
Episode 24 - Chapter 24 – "I arrived" – "We're a Ferris Wheel that Keeps on Turning"
